bit_ranges.name: DP_TX_VERSION
bit_ranges.description:
<7:5> process 
011 (Global Foundry 28nm) 
<4:3>: Version 
00: Rev A 
<2:0>: Minor revision 
000: rev .1 
Notion: It is effective when PAD_DVDD is 
supplied
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VID_CAP_FUNC_EN_N
bit_ranges.description:
Video capture functions enable. 
0: Normal operation, 
1: Disable video capture.

bit_ranges.name: VID_FIFO_FUNC_EN_N
bit_ranges.description:
Video FIFO functions enable. 
0: Normal operation, 
1: Disable video FIFO.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SW_FUNC_EN_N
bit_ranges.description:
Software defined function enable. 
0: Normal operation, 
1: Disable All the function modules. 
The bit has the highest priority, if the bit is 1, 
other function enable bits does not work.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SSC_FUNC_EN_N
bit_ranges.description:
SSC module enable. 
0: Normal mode, 
1: Disable SSC module. 
To apply updated SSC parameters into 
SSC operation, firmware must disable 
and enable this bit.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: AUX_FUNC_EN_N
bit_ranges.description:
AUX channel module function enable. 
0: Normal operation, 
1: Disable AUX channel module.

bit_ranges.name: SERDES_FIFO_FUNC_EN_N
bit_ranges.description:
Serdes FIFO function enable. 
0: Normal mode, 
1: Disable Serdes FIFO. 
To reset the serdes fifo, firmware must 
disable and enable this bit.

bit_ranges.name: LS_CLK_DOMAIN_FUNC_EN_N
bit_ranges.description:
Link symbol clock domain modules 
functions enable. 
0: Normal mode, 
1: Disable the modules in link symbol 
clock domain. 
To reset the modules in link symbol 
clock domain, firmware must disable 
and enable this bit.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VIDEO_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Video data input enable. 
0: Disable video data input. 
1: Enable video data input, 
It takes effect at next video frame.

bit_ranges.name: VIDEO_MUTE
bit_ranges.description:
Video mute enable. In video mute mode, the solid 
color, specified in Base + 0x04A8 ~ Base + 0x04B0, 
is displayed. 
0: Disable, 1: Enable. 
Output video data is changed properly as soon as this 
bit is configured.
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IN_D_RANGE
bit_ranges.description:
Dynamic range. This bit field is used to specify video 
data format in main stream attribute data. 
1: CEA range (16 ~ 235), 
0: VESA range (0 ~ 255).

bit_ranges.name: IN_BPC
bit_ranges.description:
Video input bit per color/ component (bpc). This bit 
field is used to specify video data format in main 
stream attribute data. Note that 6 bpc mode is invalid 
in YCbCr 422 mode. 
100, 101, 110, 111: Reserved, 
011: 12 bits, 
010: 10 bits, 
001: 8 bits, 
000: 6 bits.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IN_COLOR_F
bit_ranges.description:
Colorimetric format of input video. This is used to 
specify video data format in main stream attribute 
data. 
11: Reserved, 
10: YCbCr444, 
01: YcbCr422, 
00: RGB.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IN_YC_COEFFI
bit_ranges.description:
YCbCr Coefficients of input video. This is used 
to specify video data format in main stream 
attribute data. 
1: ITU709. 
0: ITU601.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VID_CHK_UPDATE_TYPE
bit_ranges.description:
Select video format stability check method in 
video capture block. 
1: Check stability with the difference between 
adjacent frames. 
0: Check stability with the difference of 
differences between adjacent frames. 
Compares difference of 1st and 2nd to 
difference of 3rd and 4th frame.
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BIST_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Video BIST enable. 
1: Enable video BIST, 
0: Normal operation mode.

bit_ranges.name: BIST_WIDTH
bit_ranges.description:
Control display BIST color bar width. 
1: Each bar is 64 pixel width, 
0: Each bar is 32 pixel width.

bit_ranges.name: BIST_TYPE
bit_ranges.description:
Display BIST type. 
00: Color bar, 
01: White, gray and black bar, 
10: Mobile white bar, 
11: Reserved.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VID_HRES_TH
bit_ranges.description:
Video Frame Horizontal Resolution variation threshold 
for video capture block. This bit field is used by 
CAPTURE block to determine whether STRM_VALID 
should be asserted.

bit_ranges.name: VID_VRES_TH
bit_ranges.description:
Video Frame Vertical Resolution variation threshold for 
video capture block. This bit field is used by CAPTURE 
block to determine whether STRM_VALID should be 
asserted.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: F_SEL
bit_ranges.description:
Video format select. 
1: Video format information from register, 
0: Video format information from video_capture 
module. 
According to the configuration of this bit field, 
the values of video format status registers in 
Base + 0x008C~ 0x00D0 are determined, which 
are transferred as main stream attribute packet. 
Note that if BIST_EN is set to 1, F_SEL must be 
cleared to 0 although video format information 
comes from registers set by user.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: SLAVE_I_SCAN_CFG
bit_ranges.description:
Interlace scan mode configuration. 
0: Progressive, 1: Interlace. 
When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in main 
stream attribute packet. 
When BIST_EN is 1, this bit field is used to 
specify the BIST video stream format.

bit_ranges.name: SLAVE_VSYNC_P_CFG
bit_ranges.description:
Slave mode VSYNC polarity configuration. 
1: Low is active, 
0: High is active. 
When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in main 
stream attribute packet. 
When BIST_EN is 1, this bit field is used to 
specify the BIST video stream format.

bit_ranges.name: SLAVE_HSYNC_P_CFG
bit_ranges.description:
Slave mode HSYNC polarity configuration. 
1: Low is active, 
0: High is active. 
When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in main 
stream attribute packet. 
When BIST_EN is 1, this bit field is used to 
specify the BIST video stream format.

name: TOTAL_LINE_CFG_L
description: Total Line Low Byte Configure Register

bit_ranges.description: Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TOTAL_LINE_CFG_L
bit_ranges.description:
TOTAL_LINE_CFG is used to specify the number 
of lines in each frame. This register is 
TOTAL_LINE_CFG [7:0]. 
When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in main 
stream attribute packet. 
When BIST_EN is 1, this bit field is used to 
specify the BIST video stream format.

name: TOTAL_LINE_CFG_H
description: Total Line High Byte Configure Register

bit_ranges.description: Reserved

bit_ranges.name: TOTAL_LINE_CFG_H
bit_ranges.description:
TOTAL_LINE_CFG is used to specify the 
number of lines in each frame. This register is 
TOTAL_LINE_CFG [11:8]. 
When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in main 
stream attribute packet. 
When Video BIST_EN is enabled, this bit must 
be configured right to generate right video 
format.

description: Active Line Low Byte Configure Register

bit_ranges.description: Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ACTIVE_LINE_CFG_L

register is ACTIVE_LINE_CFG [7:0].

stream attribute packet.

specify the BIST video stream format.

bit_ranges.name: ACTIVE_LINE_CFG_H

Reserved

bit_ranges.name: V_F_PORCH_CFG
bit_ranges.description:
This is used to specify the number of 
lines in vertical front porch part. 
When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in 
main stream attribute packet. 
When BIST_EN is 1, this bit field is 
used to specify the BIST video stream 
format.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: V_SYNC_WIDTH_CFG
bit_ranges.description:
This is used to specify the number of lines in 
VSYNC period. 
When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in main 
stream attribute packet. 
When BIST_EN is 1, this bit field is used to 
specify the BIST video stream format.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: V_B_PORCH_CFG
bit_ranges.description:

When F_SEL is 1, this value is sent in main stream

When BIST_EN is 1, this bit field is used to specify 
the BIST video stream format.

bit_ranges.name: FIELD_S
bit_ranges.description:
Interlace scan field status. 
1: Second field, 
0: First field. 
This bit field is valid only when STRM_VALID is high. 
And STRM_VALID becomes high when two 
successive frames are determined as stable.

bit_ranges.name: I_SCAN_S
bit_ranges.description:
Auto-detect interlace or progressive scan status: 
1: Interlace scan, 
0: Progressive scan. 
This bit field is valid only when STRM_VALID is high. 
And STRM_VALID becomes high when two 
successive frames are determined as stable.

bit_ranges.name: VSYNC_P_S
bit_ranges.description:
Auto-detect VSYNC polarity: 
1: Low is active, 
0: High is active. 
This bit field is valid only when STRM_VALID is high. 
And STRM_VALID becomes high when two 
successive frames are determined as stable.

bit_ranges.name: HSYNC_P_S
bit_ranges.description:
Auto-detect HSYNC polarity: 
1: Low is active, 
0: High is active. 
This bit field is valid only when STRM_VALID is high. 
And STRM_VALID becomes high when two 
successive frames are determined as stable.

bit_ranges.description: AVI Data Byte 1 ~ 13
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IF_TYPE
bit_ranges.description:
InfoFrame Packet Type Code. It can be set as (0x80 + 
InfoFrame Type Code) and send any type of infoframe 
defined in CEA-861C. 
Commonly, we set it as 0x83(0x80 + 0x03, 0x03 is the type 
code of SPD InfoFrame) and send SPD infoframe.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: IF_PKT_DB1~IF_PKT_DB25
bit_ranges.description:
InfoFrame Packet Data Byte 1 ~ 25. The 
registers define the data in the InfoFrame and 
the InfoFrame type is defined by IF_TYPE.

name: MPEG_DB1~MPEG_DB10
description: MPEG Source InfoFrame Packet Data Byte

bit_ranges.description: Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MPEG_DB1~MPEG_DB10
bit_ranges.description: MPEG InfoFrame Data Byte 1 ~ 10
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: PSR_FRAME_UP_TYPE
bit_ranges.description:
Select PSR Frame Update type. 
1 = Burst single frame update. 
0 = Single frame update. 
VSC packet is only sent once 
after PSR_FRAME_UPDATE is 
written with 1. IF_EN bit will be 
self-cleared after the VSYNC 
leading edge.

bit_ranges.name: PSR_VSC_PACKET_VERSION
bit_ranges.description:
PSR VSC packet version select. 
1 = PSR 2. 
0 = PSR 1.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VSC_SHADOW_PB0~VSC_SHADOW_PB1

Reserved

bit_ranges.description:
Control physical lane 3 will map to which logic lane: 
0b11: Logic lane 3, 
0b10: Logic lane 2, 
0b01: Logic lane 1, 
0b00: Logic lane 0,

1: Use 24M clock, 
0: Use 27M clock.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: AUX_CH_DATA_IN(RO)
bit_ranges.description:
AUX received data for debug when 
AUX_CH_TEST_MODE = 1 and 
AUX_CH_EN_TEST=0 
This bit is read only

bit_ranges.name: AUX_SEND_0_1_EN
bit_ranges.description:
1: Force 0/1 toggle in AUX CH when 
AUX_CH_TEST_MODE = 0 
0: normal AUX data transmitting in AUX CH 
when AUX_CH_TEST_MODE = 0

bit_ranges.name: AUX_CH_TEST_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
1: AUX CH is in test mode. 
0: AUX CH is in normal mode.

bit_ranges.name: AUX_CH_T_TEST
bit_ranges.description:
AUX transmitted data when 
AUX_CH_TEST_MODE = 1

bit_ranges.name: AUX_CH_EN_TEST
bit_ranges.description:
AUX TX enable when AUX_CH_TEST_MODE = 
1. 
0: disable 
1: enable

bit_ranges.name: M_VID_DEBUG_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable M_VID debugging

bit_ranges.name: AUX_TC

bit_ranges.name: INT_STATE
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt request status 
1: Interrupt service is requested, 
0: No interrupt service is requested.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: VSYNC_DET
bit_ranges.description:
1: VSYNC active edge has been detected. 
Write 1 to clear.

bit_ranges.name: PLL_LOCK_CHG
bit_ranges.description:
1: PLL lock state is changed. 
Write 1 to clear. 
Check PLL_LOCK of register

detected.

bit_ranges.name: MYDP_PLUG_OUT
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: HOTPLUG_CHG
bit_ranges.description:
1: Hot plug change detected. Write 1 to clear. 
HOTPLUG_CHG happens whenever the pin 
I_DP_HDP changes and the change remains for 
at least hot plug deglitch time. And the hot plug 
deglitch time is defined in HPD_DEGLITCH_L 
and HPD_DEGLITCH_H. When HOTPLUG_CHG is 
high, software shall check the status of HPD 
signal on register HPD_STATUS.

bit_ranges.name: PLUG
bit_ranges.description:

plugged in:

0: Not interrupt occurred

bit_ranges.description:

source.

bit_ranges.description:

source.

bit_ranges.description: HBR2 pattern control

bit_ranges.name: DET_STA
bit_ranges.description:
Video stream clock detect status, It will not 
affect video output. 
1: Stream clock detected 
0: Stream clock not detected 
Write any value to update the current 
status.

bit_ranges.name: FORCE_DET
bit_ranges.description:
Force video stream clock detect, this bit is 
only active when DET_CTRL is 1 
1: Force video stream clock detected 
0: Force video stream clock not detected 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: DET_CTRL
bit_ranges.description:
Video stream clock detect status control: 
1: Use force detect status 
0: Use auto-detected status 
This bit's type is R/W.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CHA_CRI
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel clock change detection threshold. 
The incoming pixel clock input is counted 
continuously by the 24Mhz reference clock. 
This register defines a number, if the 
counter number change is more than this 
value for 2 pixel clock edges, the CHA_STA 
bit is asserted. 
This bit's type is R/W.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CHA_STA
bit_ranges.description:
Video stream clock change status, It will 
not affect video output 
1: Clock frequency changed 
0: Clock frequency not changed 
Write any value to update the current 
status.

bit_ranges.name: FORCE_CHA
bit_ranges.description:
Force stream clock change status, this bit 
only active when CHA_CTRL is 1 
1: Force clock change. When asserted, 
CHA_STA is ‘1'. 
0: Force clock not change 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: CHA_CTRL
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel clock frequency change status control 
1: Use force change status 
0: Use auto-detected status 
This bit's type is R/W.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: HPD_STATUS(RO)
bit_ranges.description:
Hot plug detect status. 
1: HPD is 1, 
0: HPD is 0. 
This bit's type is RO. 
When this bit is 0, AUX CH will not work. 
Note that the HPD_STATUS is only changed 
after the change of the pin I_DP_HPD 
remains for no less than hot plug deglitch 
time. And the hot plug deglitch time is 
defined in HPD_DEGLITCH_L and 
HPD_DEGLITCH_H.

bit_ranges.name: F_HPD
bit_ranges.description:
Force hot plug detect. 
1: Force HPD 1, 
0: Force HPD 0. 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: HPD_CTRL
bit_ranges.description:
Hot plug detect manual control. 
1: Force HPD with F_HPD, 
0: Use PIN_HPD state. 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_RDY(RO)
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP ready status. 
1: HDCP is ready, 
0: HDCP is not ready. 
This bit's type is RO. 
This bit is an indicator of whether HDCP is 
ready to perform. Usually, it is set as soon 
as HPD signal is detected as plugged.

bit_ranges.name: STRM_VALID
bit_ranges.description:
Input stream have constant video format, 
and this stream is valid to send out 
through link. 
1: Input stream is valid, 
0: Input stream is not valid. 
Write any value to update the current 
status. 
Hardware will not send out video through 
link when this bit is 0.

bit_ranges.name: F_VALID
bit_ranges.description:
Force stream valid, this bit only active 
when VALID_CTRL is 1. 
1: Force input video stream valid, 
0: Force input video stream not valid. 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: VALID_CTRL
bit_ranges.description:
Stream valid control. 
1: Use F_VALID bit to control video stream 
valid status 
0: Use video stream valid auto-detect 
This bit's type is R/W.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: ENHANCED
bit_ranges.description:
DisplayPort Enhanced mode enable 
1: Enhanced mode, 
0: Normal mode.

bit_ranges.name: FIX_M_VID
bit_ranges.description:
Fix M_VID value 
1: Use register M_VID value to be sent out, 
0: Use calculates M_VID value to be sent 
out.

bit_ranges.name: M_VID_UPDATE_CTRL
bit_ranges.description:
Control M_VID update frequency

10: 1/4 X update rate, 
01: 1/2 X update rate, 
00: Normal rate.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: BPC
bit_ranges.description:
Bit per color/ component with video which 
transferred via DP main link 
101, 110, 111, 100: Reserved, 
011: 12 bits, 
010: 10 bits, 
001: 8 bits, 
000: 6 bits.

bit_ranges.name: YC_COEFF
bit_ranges.description:
YcbCr Coefficients with video which 
transferred via DP main link 
1: ITU709, 
0: ITU601.

bit_ranges.name: D_RANGE
bit_ranges.description:
Dynamic range 
1: CEA range, 
0: VESA range (from 0 to the maximum).

bit_ranges.name: COLOR_F
bit_ranges.description:
Colorimetric format with video which 
transferred via DP main link 
11: Reserved, 
10: YcbCr444, 
01: YcbCr422, 
00: RGB.
Reserved
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: AUDIO_INFO_UP(C)
bit_ranges.description:
Audio InfoFrame content has been 
updated. 
1: Updated, 
0: Don't care. 
Write 1 to this bit after Audio Packet 
Content Registers have been configured as 
Audio InfoFrame content has been 
updated. 
This bit's type is R/W. This bit is self 
cleared after the register configured 
content has been used to update the 
InfoFrame.

bit_ranges.name: AVI_INFO_UP(C)
bit_ranges.description:
AVI InfoFrame content has been updated. 
1: Updated, 
0: Don't care. 
Write 1 to this bit after AVI Packet Content 
Registers have been configured as AVI 
InfoFrame content has been updated. 
This bit's type is R/W. This bit is self 
cleared after the register configured 
content has been used to update the 
InfoFrame.

bit_ranges.name: MPEG_INFO_UP(C)
bit_ranges.description:
MPEG InfoFrame content has been 
updated. 
1: Updated, 
0: Don't care. 
Write 1 to this bit after MPEG Packet 
Content Registers have been configured as 
MPEG InfoFrame content has been 
updated. 
This bit's type is R/W. This bit is self 
cleared after the register configured 
content has been used to update the 
InfoFrame.

bit_ranges.name: IF_UP(C)
bit_ranges.description:
Configurable InfoFrame content has been 
updated. 
1: Updated, 
0: Don't care. 
Write 1 to this bit after IF_TYPE and 
IF_PKT_DB1~25 Registers have been 
configured as configurable InfoFrame 
content have been updated. 
This bit's type is R/W. This bit is self 
cleared after the register configured 
content has been used to update the 
InfoFrame.

bit_ranges.name: AUDIO_INFO_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Audio InfoFrame send enable. 
1: Send Audio InfoFrame, 
0: Don't send Audio InfoFrame. 
Make sure that the Audio Packet Content 
Registers had been configured correctly 
and the AUDIO_INFO_UP had been written 
with 1. 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: AVI_INFO_EN
bit_ranges.description:
AVI InfoFrame send enable. 
1: Send AVI InfoFrame, 
0: Don't send AVI InfoFrame. 
Make sure that the AVI Packet Content 
Registers had been configured correctly 
and the AVI_INFO_UP had been written 
with 1. 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: MPEG_INFO_EN
bit_ranges.description:
MPEG InfoFrame send enable. 
1: Send MPEG InfoFrame, 
0: Don't send MPEG InfoFrame. 
Make sure that the MPEG Packet Content 
Registers had been configured correctly 
and the MPEG_INFO_UP had been written 
with 1. 
This bit's type is R/W.

bit_ranges.name: IF_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Configurable InfoFrame send enable. 
1: Send InfoFrame defined in IF_TYPE and 
IF_PKT_DB1~25, 
0: Don't send InfoFrame. 
Make sure that the IF_TYPE and 
IF_PKT_DB1~25 Registers had been 
configured correctly and the IF_UP had 
been written with 1. 
This bit's type is R/W.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: MYDP_HPD_POLLIN_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Enable the MYDP HPD status polling. If this

polling both of link status and MYDP HPD 
status. 
1: Enabled 
0: Disabled. 
This bit's type is RW.

bit_ranges.description:

MYDP_HPD_POLLIN_EN and POLLING_EN 
are all enabled, hardware only polling

0: Disabled. 
This bit's type is RW.

bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: POLLING_EN
bit_ranges.description:

the HPD status or link status. The interval 
of each polling is controlled by

0: Disable polling function 
This bit's type is R/W.

This register is HPD_DEGLITCH [7:0]. The

default value is 0x1A for 280.75 us deglitch 
time.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: POLLING_PERIOD
bit_ranges.description:
This register controls the interval between 
each time of polling operation. Interval 
time = POLLING_PERIOD * 2^16 * Period 
of 24M clock.
Reserved

calculate value automatically.

M_VID variation

bit_ranges.name: AUX_BUSY
bit_ranges.description:
AUX channel status bit. If this bit is read as 1, AUX 
channel access should be halted. 
1: AUX CH is busy 
0: AUX CH is idle

bit_ranges.name: AUX_STATUS
bit_ranges.description:
This register indicate the AUX channel access status 
0: OK 
1: NACK_ERROR 
2: TIMEOUT_ERROR 
3: UNKNOWN_ERROR 
4: MUCH_DEFER_ERROR 
5: TX_SHORT_ERROR 
6: RX_SHORT_ERROR 
7: NACK_WITHOUT_M_ERROR 
8: I2C_NACK_ERROR 
Other: Reserved.

name: AUX_ERR_NUM
description: AUX Channel Access Error Code Register

bit_ranges.description: Reserved

bit_ranges.name: AUX_ERR_NUM
bit_ranges.description:
The error number counter of AUX channel 
counts when AUX channel access failed. 
In AUX CH reading, this number indicates the 
number of read back byte. 
In AUX CH writing, this number indicates the 
number of reply command.

name: AUX_CH_DEFER_CTL
description: DP AUX CH DEFER Control Register

bit_ranges.description: Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DEFER_CTRL_EN
bit_ranges.description:
AUX CH received DEFER command count 
control enable 
1: If the count that AUX CH receive DEFER 
command equal to (DEFER_COUNT * 64), 
the AUX CH transaction is terminated, and 
the AUX_STATUS is 0100 
0: The count that AUX CH receive DEFER 
command is unlimited

bit_ranges.name: DEFER_COUNT
bit_ranges.description:
The count is defined to limit the max count 
AUX CH receive DEFER command 
When DEFER_CTRL_EN is 1 and AUX CH 
received (DEFER_COUNT * 64) DEFER 
command, the AUX CH will terminate the 
transaction
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: AUX_RX_COMM

bit_ranges.name: BUF_CLR(C)
bit_ranges.description:
Write 1 to this bit to clear AUX CH data 
buffer (BUF_DATA_0 ~ BUF_DATA_15). 
Always read back 0 from this bit. 
This bit's type is R/W. This bit is self 
cleared. 
Note: For the write operation, set this bit 
to 1 before writing data to 
BUF_DATA_0~15. And for READ 
operation, this bit has only to be set 
before starting data transfer by setting 
AUX_EN.
Reserved

bit_ranges.name: DP_TEST_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
00&01: test disables dc_tp/atesto/dtesto output hiz. 
10: atesto test enable 
11: dtesto test enable

When <7:6> ==10, test analog blocks: 
000-- disable analog test 
001: enable ch0 analog test mux 
<1:0>(00/01/10/11)-- 
->(avdd10_pre_drv,avdd10_p2s, vddu_p2s,avss) 
010: enable ch1 analog test mux 
<1:0>(00/01/10/11)-- 
->(avdd10_pre_drv,avdd10_p2s, vddu_p2s,avss) 
011: enable ch2 analog test mux 
<1:0>(00/01/10/11)-- 
->(avdd10_pre_drv,avdd10_p2s, vddu_p2s,avss) 
100: enable ch3 analog test mux 
<1:0>(00/01/10/11)-- 
->(avdd10_pre_drv,avdd10_p2s, vddu_p2s,avss) 
101: enable pll analog test mux 
<1:0>(00/01/10/11)--->(vdd10_cln,v1p45_v2i, 
avdd18,vco_ctrl) 
110: enable charge pump regulator analog test mux 
<1:0> (00/01/10/11)---->(v1v_regu, 
vregu_out,v0.5_ref,null) 
111: test band gap output 
When<7:6>==11, test digital blocks: 
000-- disable digital test 
001: enable pll digital test mux 
<1:0>--(00/01/10/11)--->pll_ref,vco_fb, vss,vss. 
010: test charge pump regulator OSC clock.
Reserved
Reserved
